Strength modifies dig rate

Definition at line 2600 of file iuse.cpp.

2602{
2603 // Vastly simplified version of DDA's version, which had a 77-line-long explanation.
2604 //
2605 // Here, we simply set a target base time to dig, 60 minutes to dig a shallow pit,
2606 // 120 minutes for a deep pit. This is meant to be more in line with woodcutting,
2607 // mining, and other activities instead. Crafting quality is used to divide this like
2608 // we do with woodcutting, so deep pit is balanced around the minimum permitted quality
2609 // of 2 cutting that base time in half.
2610 //
2611 // We also must tone down the yield of dirt to avoid potential problems,
2612 // the old math was generating more than the tile volume limit.
2613 //
2614 // So to keep it simple, 50 liters for shallow pits, 100 for deep pit. We're basically
2615 // assuming that the first step is about one-third of the total work.
2616
2617 constexpr int deep_pit_time = 120;
2618 constexpr int shallow_pit_time = 60;
2619
2620 // Get the dig quality of the tool.
2621 const int quality = it->get_quality( qual_DIG );
2622
2623 ///\EFFECT_STR modifies dig rate
2624 // Adjust the dig rate if the player is above or below strength of 10.
2625 // Floor it at 1 so we don't divide by zero, of course!
2626 const double attr = 10 / std::max( 1, p->str_cur );
2627
2628 // And now determine the moves...
2629 int dig_minutes = deep ? deep_pit_time : shallow_pit_time;
2630 int moves = to_moves<int>( std::max( 10_minutes,
2631 time_duration::from_minutes( dig_minutes * attr ) / quality ) );
2632
2633 ter_id result_terrain;
2634 if( channel ) {
2635 result_terrain = ter_id( "t_water_moving_sh" );
2636 } else {
2637 result_terrain = deep ? ter_id( "t_pit" ) : ter_id( "t_pit_shallow" );
2638 }
2639
2640 return { moves, static_cast<int>( dig_minutes / 60 ), "digging_soil_loam_50L", result_terrain };
2641}

6994 }

7001 }

7003 ter_desc = trap_name + ter_desc + field_desc;

7005 description_terrain_on_figure = ter_desc;
7006 } else {
7007 ret_obj.terrain[ ter_desc ] ++;
7008 }
7009 } else {
7010 ter_desc = trap_name + ter_desc + field_desc;
7011 if( point == point_around_figure && create_figure_desc ) {
7012 description_terrain_on_figure = ter_desc;
7013 }
7014 }
7015 ignored_points.insert( point_around_figure );
